relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
I feel very safe on campus.
There are lots of things to do here, they just need more people to be apart of the organizations.
Any open minded student that is social and likes to have to meet new people will enjoy this university.
The center of campus is a water fountain, and it's said that you are not an official student until you do a fountain run!
Campus is beautiful and not overwhelmingly huge, go see it and enjoy it!
Don't go to any university with a preformed idea of what to expect and have ideas of what will happen. Go with an open mind make the best of every experience you have.
Indiana State is a great university! It is very diverse and extremely dedicated to helping the community it is a part of.
pageTitle: Indiana State University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {551623=I rate this so low because ISU is a very crowded place. Starting Spring 2014, they raffle off dorm rooms by lottery. Freshmen are guaranteed housing their first semester, but the rest of the student body may be left to find off campus housing., 253595=Terre Haute is a small close-knit community with plenty of activities. In town, there are sporting events, concerts, and festivals. Some events are free and are in walking distance from campus. Just a few miles north of Terre Haute is the home of the 4th largest festival in the United States -- the Parke County Covered Bridge Festival every October, although festival dates may be in conflict with Homecoming festivities., 172847=we march through the fountain., 244725=We currently do not have all black sororities on campus. But in the Fall of 2012 the AKA's and Delta's will be back on campus. I will plan on joining the a sorority in the FALL of 2012., 585779=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 185618=depending on your major your tuition is pretty high. as of fall of 2012 the housing prices are increasing by 200 dollars. the financial aid office is almost always busy so if you want to talk to them you must take out a lot of time in your day., 130668=Apply in September it is free to apply then., 204048=If you are in the freshman dorms and its August plan for it be a hot semester. You cannot ask for a better location at the same time if you are in the towers., 122081=If you are considering coming to Indiana State, here's a few tips I think you may find very useful. During the process of choosing your meal plan, I would advise you choose the Blue Plan. It comes with over 1300 credits and almost $300 in Commons Cash. I highly recommend this plan because it provides you with this amount every semester and you have less of a chance of being broke when the end of the semester approaches. Also, try to avoid getting into fights. Although sometimes it hurts to walk away from a fight, you must realize that your future is at stake. Also, try attending some of the campus activities. If you attend them, there's a good chance you'll be coming out of it with a new shirt, a new water bottle, or some very unique gadget!, 245205=I am also in an organization call Sister's TOO, it is a nice organization for young female. Currently it is an all black organization, but we are trying to expand it for all female on ISU campus, for the FALL 2012. We do many different activities like community service, pool parties, STD's/Safe Sex meetings and etc., 495718=We have a beautiful fountain located in the center of campus. All freshmen also take part in the March Through the Arch during their first weekend on campus.}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students This is a great school for people from small towns. The city is large enough to give you a lot of options for entertainment and small enough to make you feel comfortable. Tips for prospective students Meet your roommate before you move in. It is easier to change before you move in than after. Make sure of your career objective if your not sure take a general education and take 1 class a semester of something that you may want to study. You may discover something your naturally good at and a new career. Bang for the buck Since the fees are the same for 12credit hours up to 18 credit hours you can set your course load to your ability not to your pocket book. The room and board fees are comparable to any in the area and you can use the credits for your meals at the student union at places like Taco Bell when you miss lunch or dinner because of your schedule. Am enjoying being here My first semester was kind of bad but with the help of new friends I really have enjoyed being here. I helped to create
